app_ids.name: org.mozilla.ios.Fennec
app_ids.description: Nightly channel of Firefox for iOS.

app_ids.name: org.mozilla.ios.FirefoxBeta
app_ids.description: Beta channel of Firefox for iOS.

app_ids.name: org.mozilla.ios.Firefox
app_ids.description: Release channel of Firefox for iOS.

pings.description:
This ping is intended to provide metrics that are managed by the library
itself, and not explicitly set by the application or included in the
application's `metrics.yaml` file.
The `baseline` ping is automatically sent when the application is moved to
the background.

reasons.active:
The ping was submitted when the application became active again, which
includes when the application starts. In earlier versions, this was called
`foreground`.

*Note*: this ping will not contain the `glean.baseline.duration` metric.
reasons.dirty_startup:
The ping was submitted at startup, because the application process was
killed before the Glean SDK had the chance to generate this ping, before
becoming inactive, in the last session.

*Note*: this ping will not contain the `glean.baseline.duration` metric.
reasons.inactive:
The ping was submitted when becoming inactive. In earlier versions, this
was called `background`.

pings.name: baseline

pings.description:
This ping is submitted when a user opts out of
sending technical and interaction data to Mozilla.
This ping is intended to communicate to the Data Pipeline
that the user wishes to have their reported Telemetry data deleted.
As such it attempts to send itself at the moment the user
opts out of data collection.

reasons.at_init:
The ping was submitted at startup.
Glean discovered that between the last time it was run and this time,
upload of data has been disabled.
reasons.set_upload_enabled:
The ping was submitted between Glean init and Glean shutdown.
Glean was told after init but before shutdown that upload has changed
from enabled to disabled.

pings.name: deletion-request

pings.description:
The events ping's purpose is to transport all of the event metric
information. The `events` ping is automatically sent when the application
becomes inactive.

reasons.inactive:
The ping was submitted when becoming inactive. In earlier versions, this
was called `background`.
reasons.max_capacity: The maximum number of events was reached (default 500 events).
reasons.startup:
The ping was submitted at startup. The events ping is always sent if there
are any pending events at startup, because event timestamps can not be
mixed across runs of the application.

pings.name: events

pings.description:
The `metrics` ping is intended for all of the metrics that are explicitly
set by the application or are included in the application's `metrics.yaml`
file (except events).
The reported data is tied to the ping's *measurement window*, which is the
time between the collection of two `metrics` ping. Ideally, this window is
expected to be about 24 hours, given that the collection is scheduled daily
at 4AM. Data in the `ping_info` section of the ping can be used to infer the
length of this window.

reasons.overdue:
The last ping wasn't submitted on the current calendar day, but it's after
4am, so this ping submitted immediately
reasons.reschedule:
A ping was just submitted. This ping was rescheduled for the next calendar
day at 4am.
reasons.today:
The last ping wasn't submitted on the current calendar day, but it is
still before 4am, so schedule to send this ping on the current calendar
day at 4am.
reasons.tomorrow:
The last ping was already submitted on the current calendar day, so
schedule this ping for the next calendar day at 4am.
reasons.upgrade:
This ping was submitted at startup because the application was just
upgraded.

pings.name: metrics

metrics.name: android_sdk_version
metrics.description:
The optional Android specific SDK version of the software running on this
hardware device.

metrics.name: app.opened_as_default_browser
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times the app is opened from an external
link, implying the client has Firefox set as a default browser.

Currently this is our most accurate way of measuring how
often Firefox is set as the default browser.

metrics.name: app_build
metrics.description:
The build identifier generated by the CI system (e.g. "1234/A").
For language bindings that provide automatic detection for this value,
(e.g. Android/Kotlin), in the unlikely event that the build identifier
can not be retrieved from the OS, it is set to "inaccessible". For other
language bindings, if the value was not provided through configuration,
this metric gets set to `Unknown`.

metrics.name: app_channel
metrics.description: The channel the application is being distributed on.

metrics.name: app_display_version
metrics.description:
The user visible version string (e.g. "1.0.3").

In the unlikely event that the display version can not be retrieved,
it is set to "inaccessible".

metrics.name: app_menu.block_images_disabled
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a user disables Block Images
in the app menu

metrics.name: app_menu.block_images_enabled
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a user enables Block Images
in the app menu

metrics.name: app_menu.home
metrics.description: Counts the number of times a user taps Home in the app menu

metrics.name: app_menu.library
metrics.description: Counts the number of times a user taps Library in the app menu

metrics.name: app_menu.logins
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a user taps Logins & Passwords
in the app menu

metrics.name: app_menu.night_mode_disabled
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a user taps Disable Night Mode
in the app menu

metrics.name: app_menu.night_mode_enabled
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a user taps Enable Night Mode
in the app menu

metrics.name: app_menu.settings
metrics.description: Counts the number of times a user taps Settings in the app menu

metrics.name: app_menu.sign_into_sync
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a user taps Sign Into Sync
in the app menu

metrics.name: app_menu.whats_new
metrics.description: Counts the number of times a user taps What's New in the app menu

metrics.name: application_services.bookmark_highlights_visible
metrics.description:
Measures the state of the show bookmark highlights
preference.

metrics.name: application_services.pocket_stories_visible
metrics.description: Measures the state of the show Pocket stories preference.

metrics.name: application_services.recent_highlights_visible
metrics.description:
Measures the state of the show recent highlights
preference.

metrics.name: architecture
metrics.description: The architecture of the device, (e.g. "arm", "x86").

metrics.name: bookmarks.add
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a bookmark is added from the
following:
* Page Action Menu
* Share Menu

metrics.name: bookmarks.delete
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a bookmark is deleted from
the following:
* Page Action Menu
* Activity Stream
* Bookmarks Panel

metrics.name: bookmarks.open
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a bookmark is opened from
the following:
* Awesomebar results
* Bookmarks Panel

metrics.name: bookmarks.view_list
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times the bookmarks list is opened
from either the Home Panel tab button or the App Menu.

metrics.name: client_id
metrics.description: A UUID uniquely identifying the client.

metrics.name: default_browser_card.dismiss_pressed
metrics.description: Counts the number of times default browser card is dismissed.

metrics.name: default_browser_card.go_to_settings_pressed
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times the Go To Settings button on
default browser card is clicked.

metrics.name: default_browser_onboarding.dismiss_pressed
metrics.description: Counts the number of times default browser onboarding is dismissed.

metrics.name: default_browser_onboarding.go_to_settings_pressed
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times the Go To Settings button on
default browser onboarding is clicked.

metrics.name: deletion.fxa_device_id
metrics.description: The FxA device id.

metrics.name: deletion.sync_device_id
metrics.description: The FxA device id.

metrics.name: device_manufacturer
metrics.description:
The manufacturer of the device the application is running on.
Not set if the device manufacturer can't be determined (e.g. on Desktop).

metrics.name: device_model
metrics.description:
The model of the device the application is running on.
On Android, this is Build.MODEL, the user-visible marketing name,
like "Pixel 2 XL".
Not set if the device model can't be determined (e.g. on Desktop).

metrics.name: end_time
metrics.description:
The time of the end of collection of the data in the ping,
in local time and with minute precision, including timezone information.
This is also the time this ping was generated
and is likely well before ping transmission time.

metrics.name: experiments
metrics.description: Optional. A dictionary of active experiments.

metrics.name: experiments.experiment_enrollment
metrics.description:
Records the experiments the user is enrolled in.
Includes experiment ID, name, and variant.

experiment_variant.description: The experiment variant name the user is in.

metrics.name: first_run_date
metrics.description: The date of the first run of the application.

metrics.name: glean.baseline.duration
metrics.description: The duration of the last foreground session.

metrics.name: glean.baseline.locale
metrics.description:
The locale of the application during initialization (e.g. "es-ES").
If the locale can't be determined on the system, the value is
["und"](https://unicode.org/reports/tr35/#Unknown_or_Invalid_Identifiers),
to indicate "undetermined".

metrics.name: glean.core.migration.successful
metrics.description: Reports `true` if the client was successfully migrated from the Android-specific implementation of the Glean SDK to the cross-platform one.

metrics.name: glean.database.size
metrics.description: The size of the database file at startup.

metrics.name: glean.error.invalid_label
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a metric was set with an invalid label.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

metrics.name: glean.error.invalid_overflow
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a metric was set a value that overflowed.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

metrics.name: glean.error.invalid_state
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a timing metric was used incorrectly.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

metrics.name: glean.error.invalid_value
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a metric was set to an invalid value.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

metrics.name: glean.error.io
metrics.description:
The number of times we encountered an IO error
when writing a pending ping to disk.

metrics.name: glean.error.preinit_tasks_overflow
metrics.description:
The number of tasks queued in the pre-initialization buffer.
Only sent if the buffer overflows.

metrics.name: glean.error.preinit_tasks_timeout
metrics.description: Set to true if the tasks that are queued prior to Glean initialization time out.

metrics.name: glean.time.invalid_timezone_offset
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times we encountered an invalid timezone offset
when trying to get the current time.
A timezone offset is invalid if it is outside [-24h, +24h].
If invalid a UTC offset is used (+0h).

metrics.name: glean.upload.deleted_pings_after_quota_hit
metrics.description:
The number of pings deleted after the quota
for the size of the pending pings directory or number of files is hit.
Since quota is only calculated for the pending pings directory,
and deletion request ping live in a different directory,
deletion request pings are never deleted.

metrics.name: glean.upload.discarded_exceeding_pings_size
metrics.description: The size of pings that exceeded the maximum ping size allowed for upload.

metrics.name: glean.upload.pending_pings
metrics.description:
The total number of pending pings at startup.
This does not include deletion-request pings.

metrics.name: glean.upload.pending_pings_directory_size
metrics.description:
The size of the pending pings directory upon initialization of Glean.
This does not include the size of the deletion request pings directory.

metrics.name: glean.upload.ping_upload_failure
metrics.description:
Counts the number of ping upload failures, by type of failure.
This includes failures for all ping types,
though the counts appear in the next successfully sent `metrics` ping.

metrics.name: glean.validation.app_forceclosed_count
metrics.description: This metric counts how many times a dirty bit was detected when starting the Glean SDK, on Android. This dirty bit is set to `true` when Android's lifecycle `ON_START` is hit and flipped back to false on `ON_STOP`. When an application is force-closed, it might not get the `ON_STOP` and so the value would stay `true`. The next time Glean starts, it will increment this counter.

metrics.name: glean.validation.baseline_ping_count
metrics.description: The number of baseline pings sent during the lifetime of this metrics ping.

metrics.name: glean.validation.first_run_hour
metrics.description: The hour of the first run of the application.

metrics.name: glean.validation.foreground_count
metrics.description: On mobile, the number of times the application went to foreground.

metrics.name: glean.validation.metrics_ping_count
metrics.description: The number of metrics pings sent during the lifetime of this baseline ping.

metrics.name: glean.validation.pings_submitted
metrics.description:
A count of the pings submitted, by ping type.

This metric appears in both the metrics and baseline pings.

- On the metrics ping, the counts include the number of pings sent since
  the last metrics ping (including the last metrics ping)
- On the baseline ping, the counts include the number of pings send since
  the last baseline ping (including the last baseline ping)

metrics.name: legacy.ids.client_id
metrics.description: The client id from legacy telemetry.

metrics.name: library.panel_pressed
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a specific library panel
button is tapped for Bookmarks, History, Reading List,
Downloads and Synced tabs

metrics.name: locale
metrics.description:
The locale of the application during initialization (e.g. "es-ES").
If the locale can't be determined on the system, the value is
["und"](https://unicode.org/reports/tr35/#Unknown_or_Invalid_Identifiers),
to indicate "undetermined".

metrics.name: nimbus_events.disqualification
metrics.description: Recorded when a user becomes ineligible to continue receiving the treatment for an enrolled experiment, for reasons such as the user opting out of the experiment or no longer matching targeting for the experiment.

branch.description: The branch slug/identifier that was randomly chosen

enrollment_id.description: A unique identifier generated at enrollment time

experiment.description: The slug/unique identifier of the experiment

metrics.name: nimbus_events.enrollment
metrics.description: Recorded when a user has met the conditions and is first bucketed into an experiment (i.e. targeting matched and they were randomized into a bucket and branch of the experiment). Expected a maximum of once per experiment per user.

branch.description: The branch slug/identifier that was randomly chosen

enrollment_id.description: A unique identifier generated at enrollment time

experiment.description: The slug/unique identifier of the experiment

metrics.name: nimbus_events.exposure
metrics.description: Recorded when a user actually observes an experimental treatment, or would have observed an experimental treatment if they had been in a branch that would have shown one.

branch.description: The branch slug/identifier that was randomly chosen

enrollment_id.description: A unique identifier generated at enrollment time

experiment.description: The slug/unique identifier of the experiment

metrics.name: nimbus_events.unenrollment
metrics.description: Recorded when either telemetry is disabled, or the experiment has run for its designed duration (i.e. it is no longer present in the Nimbus Remote Settings collection)

branch.description: The branch slug/identifier that was randomly chosen

enrollment_id.description: A unique identifier generated at enrollment time

experiment.description: The slug/unique identifier of the experiment

metrics.name: os
metrics.description:
The name of the operating system.
Possible values:
Android, iOS, Linux, Darwin, Windows,
FreeBSD, NetBSD, OpenBSD, Solaris, unknown

metrics.name: os_version
metrics.description:
The user-visible version of the operating system (e.g. "1.2.3"). If the
version detection fails, this metric gets set to `Unknown`.

metrics.name: page_action_menu.add_to_reading_list
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a user taps Add to Reading List
in the page action menu

metrics.name: page_action_menu.copy_address
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a user taps Copy Address
in the page action menu

metrics.name: page_action_menu.find_in_page
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a user taps Find in Page
in the page action menu

metrics.name: page_action_menu.pin_to_top_sites
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a user taps Pin to Top Sites
in the page action menu

metrics.name: page_action_menu.remove_pinned_site
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a user taps Pin to Top Sites
in the page action menu

metrics.name: page_action_menu.report_site_issue
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a user taps Report Site Issue
in the page action menu

metrics.name: page_action_menu.request_desktop_site
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a user taps Request Desktop Site
in the page action menu

metrics.name: page_action_menu.request_mobile_site
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a user taps Request Mobile Site
in the page action menu

metrics.name: page_action_menu.send_to_device
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a user taps Send to Device
in the page action menu

metrics.name: page_action_menu.share_page_with
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a user taps Share Page With in the
page action menu

metrics.name: ping_reason
metrics.description:
The optional reason the ping was submitted.
The specific values for reason are specific to each ping, and are
documented in the ping's pings.yaml file.

metrics.name: pocket.open_story
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a user opens
Pocket article from Firefox home Pocket feed

metrics.name: preferences.block_popups
metrics.description: Measures the state of the "Block Popups" preference.

metrics.name: preferences.changed
metrics.description:
Recorded when a preference is changed and includes the
preference that changed as well as the value changed to
recorded in the extra keys.

changed_to.description: The value the preference was changed to.

metrics.name: preferences.close_private_tabs
metrics.description: Measures the state of the "Close Private Tabs" preference.

metrics.name: preferences.mail_client
metrics.description:
The URL scheme of the mail client that the user wants to use
for `mailto:` links. It is used to measure usage of this
feature, to see how effective feature promotion campaigns are
and to report back to third-party mail clients what percentage
of users is using their client.

metrics.name: preferences.new_tab_experience
metrics.description:
The name of the view that the user wants to see on new tabs.
For example History, Homepage or Blank. It is used to measure
usage of this feature, to see how effective feature promotion
campaigns are and to establish a baseline number for when we
introduce the new Activity Stream features.

metrics.name: preferences.save_logins
metrics.description: Measures the state of the "Save Logins" preference.

metrics.name: preferences.show_clipboard_bar
metrics.description: Measures the state of the "Show Clipboard Bar" preference.

metrics.name: qr_code.scanned
metrics.description: Counts the number of times a QR code is scanned.

metrics.name: reader_mode.close
metrics.description: Counts how many times the reader mode is closed.

metrics.name: reader_mode.open
metrics.description: Counts how many times the reader mode is opened.

metrics.name: reading_list.add
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times an item is added to the reading
list from the following:
* Reader Mode Toolbar
* Share Extension
* Page Action Menu

metrics.name: reading_list.delete
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times an item is added to the
reading list from the following:
* Reader Mode Toolbar
* Reading List Panel

metrics.name: reading_list.mark_read
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a reading list item is
marked as read.

metrics.name: reading_list.mark_unread
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a reading list item is
marked as unread.

metrics.name: reading_list.open
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times an item is opened from the
Reading List

metrics.name: reason
metrics.description:
The optional reason the ping was submitted.
The specific values for reason are specific to each ping, and are
documented in the ping's pings.yaml file.

metrics.name: search.counts
metrics.description:
The labels for this counter are `{search-engine-name}.{source}`

If the search engine is bundled with Firefox-iOS, then
`search-engine-name` will be the name of the search engine. If
it is a custom search engine, the value will be `custom`.

The value of `source` will reflect the source from which the
search started.  One of:
* quicksearch
* suggestion
* actionbar

metrics.name: search.default_engine
metrics.description:
The default search engine identifier if the search engine is
pre-loaded with Firefox-iOS.  If it's a custom search engine,
then the value will be 'custom'.

metrics.name: search.google_topsite_pressed
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times the google top site button
is pressed

metrics.name: search.in_content
metrics.description: Records the type of interaction a user has on SERP pages.

metrics.name: search.start_search_pressed
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times the start search button is
pressed

metrics.name: seq
metrics.description: A running counter of the number of times pings of this type have been sent

metrics.name: settings_menu.set_as_default_browser_pressed
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times setting as default
browser menu option is tapped.

metrics.name: start_time
metrics.description:
The time of the start of collection of the data in the ping,
in local time and with minute precision, including timezone information.

metrics.name: sync.create_account_pressed
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a user taps
on create account button in sync library view

metrics.name: sync.open_sync_home_shortcut
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a user opens
synced tab list from home view

metrics.name: sync.open_tab
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a user opens
synced tab

metrics.name: sync.sign_in_sync_pressed
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a user taps
on sign in to sync button in sync
library view

metrics.name: tabs.click_tab
metrics.description: Recorded when a user clicks an open tab

metrics.name: tabs.close
metrics.description:
The count of tabs closed by the user. Increments the
appropriate label when either a normal or private tab
is closed.

metrics.name: tabs.close_all
metrics.description:
The count of times the user closes all tabs. Increments the
appropriate label when either a normal or private tab
is closed.

metrics.name: tabs.close_tab_tray
metrics.description: Recorded when a user closes the tab tray

metrics.name: tabs.cumulative_count
metrics.description:
Measures the current open tab count as the application
goes to background. Each background event adds to this
metric, making it the cumulative sum of all open tabs
when the app goes to background during the period of
time covered by a single metrics ping. This can be
divided by the number of baseline pings with
`ping_info.reason="inactive"` from the `start_time` to
the `end_time` of the metrics ping to determine the
average open tabs per foreground "session".

metrics.name: tabs.new_tab_pressed
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times the add new tab button is
pressed

metrics.name: tabs.open
metrics.description:
The count of tabs opened by the user. Increments the
appropriate label when either a normal or private tab
is opened.

metrics.name: tabs.open_tab_tray
metrics.description: Recorded when a user opens the tab tray

metrics.name: theme.automatic_mode
metrics.description:
Measures the state of the "Manual/Automatic" theme
preference.

metrics.name: theme.automatic_slider_value
metrics.description:
Measures the string representation of the current slider
value of the automatic theme switching slider.

metrics.name: theme.name
metrics.description:
Measures the name of the current theme.  One of:
* normal
* dark

metrics.name: theme.use_system_theme
metrics.description:
Measures the state of the "Use System Light/Dark Mode"
theme preference.

metrics.name: tracking_protection.enabled
metrics.description:
Measures the state of the tracking-protection enabled
preference.

metrics.name: tracking_protection.strength
metrics.description:
A string representing the selected strength of the
tracking-protection that is enabled. One of:
* basic
* strict

metrics.name: widget.l_tabs_open_url
metrics.description: Counts how many times the large tabs widget opens url

metrics.name: widget.m_quick_action_close_private
metrics.description:
Counts how many times medium quick action
widget closes private tabs

metrics.name: widget.m_quick_action_copied_link
metrics.description:
Counts how many times medium quick action
widget opens copied links

metrics.name: widget.m_quick_action_private_search
metrics.description:
Counts how many times medium quick action
widget opens firefox for private search

metrics.name: widget.m_quick_action_search
metrics.description:
Counts how many times medium quick action
widget opens firefox for regular search

metrics.name: widget.m_tabs_open_url
metrics.description: Counts how many times the medium tabs widget opens url

metrics.name: widget.m_top_sites_widget
metrics.description: Counts how many times user opens top site tabs

metrics.name: widget.s_quick_action_search
metrics.description:
Counts how many times small quick action
widget opens firefox for regular search
